description: Document all new toolkit additions from Feb 23–28, 2026: new skills, agent resilience upgrades, new project.json schema fields, the authentication system, Electron E2E testing support, and the cross-machine pending-updates registry.

userStories.title: Document new skills (skills manifest sync)
userStories.description: As a user browsing /skills, I want to see all newly added skills so I know what tools are available.
acceptanceCriteria: Manifest extraction script outputs all new skills (setup-auth, auth-generic, auth-headless, auth-nextauth-credentials, auth-supabase-otp, auth-supabase-password, test-user-cleanup, browser-debugging, vectorize, cve, e2e-electron, e2e-quality, git-sync, product-screenshots, marketing-copy, post-completion)
All new skills appear on the /skills index page under the correct type
Detail pages (/skills/[slug]) render correctly for each new skill
Total skill count on homepage and /skills page is updated
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser
userStories.notes: Skills page is fully dynamic — reads from toolkit-manifest.json which already contains all 44 skills including all new skills (setup-auth, auth-generic, auth-headless, auth-nextauth-credentials, auth-supabase-otp, auth-supabase-password, test-user-cleanup, browser-debugging, vectorize, cve, e2e-electron, e2e-quality, git-sync, product-screenshots, marketing-copy, post-completion). No code changes needed.

userStories.title: Document Agent Resilience Upgrades
userStories.description: As a developer using the toolkit, I want the website to explain the new resilience features added to primary agents so I understand how agents behave under failure conditions.
acceptanceCriteria: The /concepts/the-human-in-the-loop page includes a new 'Agent Resilience' section or callout box
Section explains rate limit handling (429 detection, graceful pause with state save)
Section explains session resumability (currentTask state tracking)
Section explains the commit gate (Builder won't commit if post-change workflow is incomplete)
Section explains tool error recovery (499/timeout auto-retry)
Content is written for end users, not toolkit developers
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser

userStories.title: Document new project.json schema fields
userStories.description: As a developer setting up a project, I want the /concepts/projects page to show all current project.json fields including new ones from Feb 23–28.
acceptanceCriteria: The /concepts/projects annotated project.json example includes codeRoot, toolkitPath, environments, authentication, apps[], and git.autoCommit with explanations
A 'Multi-Platform Apps' sub-section explains the apps[] field with web + Electron config examples
The devPort: null option is documented
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser

userStories.title: Document the Authentication System
userStories.description: As a developer who wants E2E tests that require login, I want the website to explain the authentication system so I can configure my project for authenticated testing.
acceptanceCriteria: New page or major section documents the authentication system
Explains the purpose: letting E2E tests authenticate to test protected pages
Explains setup-auth skill usage
Includes provider matrix table (Supabase OTP, Supabase password, NextAuth credentials, generic form, headless API injection)
Explains how agents use auth config once set up
Documents test-user-cleanup skill
Linked from Getting Started guide
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser

userStories.title: Document Electron E2E Testing Support
userStories.description: As a developer building an Electron desktop app, I want the website to explain how to configure and run E2E tests for Electron using the toolkit.
acceptanceCriteria: Testing concepts page includes an 'Electron Desktop Testing' section
Explains how to configure project.json with an Electron app entry (example shown)
Explains e2e-electron skill and when it is loaded
Explains difference between Playwright web and Playwright Electron API
Documents executablePath and devLaunchArgs fields with examples
Includes a minimal working project.json example for an Electron app
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser

userStories.title: Document cross-machine pending-updates registry
userStories.description: As a toolkit user working across multiple machines, I want the website to explain the cross-machine pending-updates system so I know how toolkit updates propagate to my projects automatically.
acceptanceCriteria: New section in /concepts/workflow or dedicated page explains the pending-updates system
Explains three sources (project-local, central registry, legacy per-project folder)
Explains affinity rules for matching updates to projects
Documents applied-updates.json tracking
Explains who writes updates and how they are applied
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser

userStories.title: Document git.autoCommit and identity lock improvements
userStories.description: As a developer who wants more control over when agents commit, I want the website to document the git.autoCommit: false option and the improved identity lock system.
acceptanceCriteria: /concepts/projects or workflow page documents git.autoCommit: false with when to use it and what it does
Brief note on Human-in-the-Loop or workflow page mentions hardened identity locks
Root cause analysis requirement is mentioned
Typecheck passes
Lint passes
Verify in browser
